basics.name: Camilo Lozano
basics.label: Software Engineer
basics.summary: Hi! I'm from Miami, FL and come from a Colombian background. I have been a developer for 5+ years. I specialize in backend development with a passion for optimizing and automating workflows with DevOps tools.

work.name: Blue Origin
work.description: New Glenn Integrated Ground Systems (NG IGS)
work.summary: Work on the team developing the software used for launch operations of the New Glenn rocket. Our product provides the telemetry and commincation system for interfacing between ground control, the rocket and other providers. Requiring a high throughput backend for handling massive changes per second.  In charge of DevOps and CI/CD for team as well as working on the backend of our product.
highlights: Sped up pipeline runtimes by 20% by parallelizing builds and tests
Developed packaging system for project used by all our customers. Deployed RPMs, NSIS, WHL. Allowing for faster deployments and software turnaround
Developed panels/displays in Qt for launch control
Created tooling and infrastructure for integrating QT Squish testing. Paved way for automating of verification and validation tests
Implemented and delivered a C++ API for interfacing with internal service. Used GTest for e2e testing
Worked on integrating GPT into developer workflow for testing, documentation and debugging

work.name: NASA (TOSC)
work.summary: In this role I worked directly on the next iteration of the Launch Control System (LCS) that is used by NASA to launch the Artermis SLS rocket. I helped lead a team that worked in the restructuring of the current architecture. Previously new software revisions would take on the magntidue of days from commit to deployment on hardware.
highlights: Founding member and sub lead of new DevOps team made to reimplement LCS
Sped up software deployment time from order of days to hours
Administered and managed Gitlab (as well as our own runners, scaled through k8s )and Artifactory instances
Decoupled bulk data injest from build step to post build on demand
Containerization of existing software into microservices

work.name: NASA Swampworks
work.summary: Internship in conjunction with UCF, Florida Space Institute (FSI) and NASA Swampworks. In this project we were tasked with creating an open source implmentation of an existing Swampworks robot the RASSOR for use in situ mining. Our version would be mostly 3D printed and feature a full simulation.
highlights: Used ROS for Pub/Sub real time system (RTS) commnucation between components.
Developed application in React Native for controlling of robot
Created Blender models for use in Gazebo simulation

work.name: Ektec
work.summary: Ektec is a start up based in Miami that provides an open payment system for transportation systems, mainly servicing in Latin America. Allowing for use of regular bank cards at bus/transit/metro stops instead of a metro card. The product functioned as an edge computing application, with unreliable network connection. Device procesed transactions asynchronously, and synced whenever network was available
highlights: Created an application in Python for processing asynchronous credit card transactions on an embedded system
Integrated POS terminal, GPS, GPRS modem, relay switches to interface all together, for use in transit systems.
Sole developer for embedded device, in charge of deployment, maintenance and life cycle of devices
Setup provisioning of devices, as well as maintaining and updating fleet of devices
